tTW6z5zBOBnLz9FpcmMN8A.text: I love Amelie's so I was anxious to try this new location at Park Road.  Popped in after dinner and glad we did.  It's such a cute oasis at the Park Road Shopping Center Backlot.  Cute, signature eclectic decor with French flair.    I had the seasonal caramel apple petit gateaux....so nice to look at and nice to eat!  Can't go without an Amelie's latte.  I don't know how they do it but they have the best lattes I have ever had. It's like rediscovering coffee all over again.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caramel apple petit gateaux!

PZgKjQT6rZde7UFULY4Bpg.text: Waking into Amelie's bakery, I expected the same amazing service and kindness I received at all other locations. However, upon getting in line I was greeted unpleasantly by the woman behind the glass case saying "listen up because I'm not saying these macaron flavors again." After only catching Half of the macaron flavors, I pointed to a flavor asking to purchase it. Her response was "you're going to have to name the flavor I cant tell what you're pointing to". I feel that going to a restaurant is not only about the food, but about the experience. And customers should not be made to feel as though they are burden. I will not be returning to this locations.

78AQpJzkv4oK2sbqsYUnWQ.text: Love Amelie's eclairs; but some of the worker could be nicer. We came in late around 10.30 on a weekday after dinner and we could feel the worker wanted us out ASAP because he started cleaning.

GnKADgTJYabsq2J2VRZ45A.text: Paris on Park! Great coffees with exceptional pastries and othe flavorable fresh sweet options.  Clean, fun and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Funky seats next to faux fire, coffee and dessert real deal.

R89tHKQLB9mjjnyarc3fkw.text: Perfect breakfast spot! Very similar to the original, but with a waaaay better layout! Even a nice open patio :)

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Sammie
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Sammie
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salted Carmel Brownie &amp; Macaroon

q5fzG1Ra8Y75DmzAud5lpg.text: Not worth the $12 you'll likely spend on a baked good and coffee. I've been to every Amelie's location in Charlotte and the only one that delivers quality is the NoDa Amelie's.  After dinner yesterday we went to the Park Road location. Their dessert case isn't as robust as others but that didn't bother me because whatever I taste I care about the quality. We ordered two macaroons, a petite four, and slice of cake. The cake was good, the macaroons were okay, but my hazelnut petite four truly tasted like it had freezer burn (kind of like if cardboard had a taste). To me, if I pay $2.15 for a dessert it should be worth it's wait because baking is such a unique skill.  The atmosphere was fine, it's an open floor plan and a bit noisey but you can comfortably have a conversation. I wouldn't be able to study at this location though or read a book.

qKQ6hz9CIyP4e3x8xN_zBQ.text: I love the chai tea and when it's made with almond milk it's even better for me! Add a palmier to that and it's a perfect snack. Everyone is always nice and the food is great. Always enjoy a trip to Amelie's at Park Rd!

e2aCJXUeClHKJ8TqUfQ-ug.text: So, I'm on the hunt for an eclair made the way my favorite bakery back in San Diego made them: a long, wide generous size filled with a sweet, light vanilla pastry cream (as in not pudding-heavy and not whipped cream-light) with a rich, glossy decadent chocolate glaze. It definitely took more than four bites to eat. While I do like the traditional thin French ones, I find I need more than one to satisfy me and they often have a high pastry shell to cream ratio. So, when I was considering relocating to Charlotte, I was excited to hear that a popular place was a French bakery called Amelie's. I eagerly tried their eclair and was sad it wasn't like my old favorite. But that's not to say it isn't good. It's just different.  I tried both their vanilla and chocolate version. While good, I found their filling dense and heavier than I would have liked. I didn't give up on them though. Their vanilla cream puff is closer to what I was hoping for. The glaze is rich, soft and glossy and balances the pastry shell and vanilla cream filling nicely. I do find the filling a tad too light than I would like, but it's pretty good. There's no suffering involved eating 2-3 to equal my old favorite eclair size. I'm still on the hunt, so read my other reviews to see if I've found the "one."  I've also had their salted caramel brownie. It's a moist fudge-like brownie as opposed to a cakey brownie. Very tasty and yummy with a cup of their cafe au lait. Their twice-baked croissant was delicious. They were serving a chocolate hazelnut version when I ordered. It made a delicious snack along my drive to Arlington, VA that day.  While they didn't match my favorite eclair style, they're a delicious and solid bakery option and still deserve 5 stars.

X8Ttv-fwopBVIrs6kPqoPw.text: Can Amelie's disappoint? Unlikely. Every location I try is fantastic. I am just a huge fan of their late hours. We love to bring friends here after dinner for a sweet treat. Everything is always fabulous from the food to the drinks to the decor. I especially thought the staff here was personable, attentive, and kind! Way to go!

wDDBkHXm07Bk2EaCWL6TNg.text: So sad that I didn't know about this incredible place sooner! The atmosphere alone is worth a visit; such fun and unique decor really sets a fun ambiance. The pastries though. Everything in those glass cases looks incredible and the textures and flavors do not disappoint! Cannot wait to visit Amelie's other locations as well. This shop's hours are awesome for a night owl such as myself, too!

7CuvTB7f2CjHMWiSTY2zKg.text: Pro- tip. Start with a bike ride from freedom park. Bike for a little over 2 miles to park road shopping center and stop in for an iced coffee and maybe a sweet before heading back to freedom park. A great way to spend a Saturday morning!

17d2oNZ12In09jSd_LROKA.text: I just moved here from Florida, and at first I was so excited to have found a French Bakery especially close to my new home, but today was my 3rd time there as I truly wanted to love this place, and unfortunately it's not working out... -First time I went the quiche was cold in the middle; and it seems the staff matched that very same state. -Second time I tested them to make sure maybe it was just a one time little boo boo (i mean no one's perfect..no big deal) but lol the quiche was again cold in the center ...?!? I tried their mini cake bouchee which was good except for the chocolate one that tasted like dirt+sugar, but no offense that's just cause I hate chocolate. My bad-I guess I was hoping that place would change that but oh well..!  The staff it feels wanted to be nice, I mean the effort was there but wasn't fooling anyone.  -So the third time I went, the mixed berry tart was good! But the macaroons I had to throw away except the cotton candy one.. That time the staff seemed to me that they just didnt want to be there..  It's unfortunate to see a place with such great potential can be sooo careless about their guests' satisfaction. For a bakery to be selling "sweets", well the staff is just bitter! Or maybe it's my fault for having greater expectations... and they shld start warming up these quiches to a higher degree btw!!!

3utpwnhMyWxliyyqcDX0uw.text: More of the same great Amelies I have come to expect in a new location much closer to my house. I have been here 3 times now and each experience has certainly met expectations. Most times have been a jump in and jump out to grab sweets to go, but the most recent was with my wife and we ended up grabbing a glass of wine in addition of the treats to go. This location has a ton of seating and the decorations certainly can keep you entertained for a while. We also have had great service here. A neat example is where my wife wanted a gluten free caramel salted brownie and the server asked if she needed to grab new gloves to prevent cross contamination. Talk about attention to detail! They are also always on point when I ask them to do a full run down of all of the macaroon flavors. The net takeaway is don't pass on Amelies if you are looking for a great dessert!

NdtwfqFkook4cA-2bntYIA.text: Decor is cute, drinks are okay, desserts are average. I can't speak on the quality of the cafe food, but I felt that the desserts are definitely overrated. I tried several different things at several different visits, and nothing was phenomenal. The macaroons were especially a disappointment as the  shell was very grainy and honestly the whole thing tasted somewhat stale. I have also tried the eclair, which also tasted a little dry. It's a cute atmosphere to do work in or chat with friends, but in my opinion, there are much better desserts.

5sOasbaW2OTU3SJBZGaEng.text: I'm so glad this side of town has an Amelie's! They kept the same unique aesthetic alive in this location which has tons of indoor and outdoor seating. Just walk down the steps and the line to order is on your right, or take the accessible entrance and walk through the cafe to get to the line. Either way, it's small enough to feel cozy but big enough to always find a seat. Great staff, very clean, completely awesome.

F8fdYF3XP6Hn3QDvrurkRA.text: I've been here a few times. Service is always great. Food is always great. Love their Bacon and Turkey, and the squash soup. Also, you must try the cider this season. To die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple Cider. So warm! So good!

Z1gpZ44RFnqI3giISHywHA.text: Want to give Amelie's another try. Again I don't recommend the food. It's lazily put together and not much quality control as with other locations. Croissant was burnt/overcooked and crumbled. No condiments on the blt. The soup was mediocre and I ate it since I was starving. The ice tea cups are tiny and no real good way to get refills, especially when the line is long. Desserts are okay, nothing special.  The interior is smaller than other spaces they have, but it's clean and comfortable seating. I also like the coffee bar type seating they have on the upper level so if you come alone you don't feel like you are taking up the whole table. There also not a spectate ordering line for food/coffee and dessert so the line readily backed up during lunch. I really want to like Amelie's again, but quality just plummeted since 2013. Adios Amelie's.

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sample Of seating upstairs

xy_1YUTsAUn35roP9SC8fQ.text: So many amazing gluten free options -- from breakfast sandwiches to delicious desserts. Everything was amazing and the service was excellent

_k5hikGFq2B4yBqyxxqZjQ.text: Came here for the first time for lunch while in town for a leadership conference. All i can say is you have to try ALL the macaroons!!! So cute and cozy too. Super friendly staff. Definitely a must next time I'm in town.

aqCwyubmZKjVkknErXaWCw.text: Love, love, love. This has become the go to place for birthday office lunches. It's fast, the food is amazing and not just the pastries and the service is awesome and these ladies don't even work off tips. Just a great place so happy to have location so close by .. Great job

b1gA_C8n4H6RHEC7KCKFgw.text: Another must do on my list when visiting Charlotte, NC, is stop in to one of the three Amelie's locations.  In January, my son and his girl friend took me to the one on N. Davidson Street.  I loved the whole look and feel of that place.  This new store is located in the Park Road Shopping Center with fairly good parking.  Also, I was happy to learn that it is only about 2 miles from my son's home.  The interior is done very nicely, but I think The Davidson location had more of an older, eclectic decor.   Although, it was very busy, the line moved quickly.  The staff was very friendly in spite of so many people coming in after church or stopping in for brunch.  We got our pastries and we're lucky enough to find an empty table inside.  There is a nice small patio  with seating, too.   I choose a mixed berry fruit tart and hot chocolate for my beverage.  There was a bit of a wait for the beverages and coffees.  The staff did an awesome job keeping up with so many orders.  Everything I had was very good.  The sandwiches and salads of other customers looked delicious.    I have no hesitation on returning here.  Great place.

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. I tried the mixed berry tart - mmmmm

B1YPxZCQrcbXL5RQ3IKTIQ.text: This location was beautiful. I had the asparagus and carrot soup. Very yummy. I also enjoyed a glass of their strawberry mimosa. The price was a little high but it was tasty.

rD1aIqg8yCQeRlzODQUA7w.text: I like this Amelie's probably the best of the 4 I've been to. The employees are nice and they usually have a good selection of desserts. They have a good amount of seating & it just feels comfortable and not stuffy. The chocolate raspberry cake I had recently was really dry (still tasty) but all the other things I've tried have been great. They have some innovative non alcoholic drinks which is a nice treat.

dyyepOi82QJFOAHWbFnFyw.text: Convenient location near Southpark Mall but not the same cool atmosphere as the NODA location.  Same desserts but I think this location has some different items like the walnut tart unless it was a newbee of the season.  It was really good.  There's outside seating just before walking in.  Pretty landscaping, windows, and a high rise sitting area.

MetiOEQd2jxwLJVBBb3ggQ.text: Who doesn't love overpriced baked goods and mediocre coffee?! These places are all pretty equal in terms of service, quality of food, and witnessing way too many people on laptops at odd hours of the day (do you guys not pay for internet at home?). They have an interesting spread with some items being notably delicious (I.e. the salted caramel brownie and their muffins).   Prices are pretty steep for some things. I walked out $15 poorer with a brownie, a muffin, and cup of black coffee. Maybe some things are worth going often for, but I have yet to discover those. 3/5 as I have yet to have anything that's just mind blowing and the service is fair.

joCJq8tv9JIK3CIWouKADw.text: Sweetness of every bite! The new location of Amelie's includes salted caramel brownies and all the goodness of this French bakery. I am a True fan of Amelie's and the eccentric decorations delighted me. They have a macaron chandelier!  One of 42 chandeliers hanging there in the restaurant.  And I love the chai drinks with almond milk.  They face the back side of Park Rd shopping center by the garden store from Blackhawk and across from Midwood. There's plenty of parking in the back lot.  The entrance is down the stairs like a basement but it's like a fun East Village vibe. The patio looks cozy when it's cool in the fall. Happy to have another respite in Amelie's world!

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wall of fame

LeL1IgbOWnrGLNVdrHSHVA.text: We've always gone to the original Amelie's in NoDa, but it's always a "special trip," as we don't live near there.  So when they started to branch out to other locations around Charlotte, we were able to make a few other unplanned visits when out and about.  We've tried the one near Pineville and the one in Uptown.  Both were MEH.  It didn't seem like they cared or tried as hard as the NoDa location and employees.  And neither seemed to have a good selection of items, no matter what time of day it was. So when the Park Road Shopping Center one opened up, we were a little hesitant.  This is the closest one to us yet, though, so we went.  I'm happy to report that we've been twice so far now!    They had a good selection of items (even at night, which is when we usually go for dessert).  We picked up two chocolate croissants to bring home to enjoy while watching a movie.  However, the macarons (not to be confused with a macaroon) looked tempting and looked small enough to enjoy there quickly before heading home with the croissants.  Surprisingly, it was my first time ever having a French macaron.  There were so many flavors to choose from.  Unfortunately, they're not labeled, though, so I have to make the employee give me the run down on the flavors each and every time.  It must get old for them, but hey -- slap some labels on them.  I chose the raspberry one.  After that first bite, I realized I'm never going back to croissants.  This was now and will forever be my Amelie's dessert of choice.  It was just so amazing.  It looks like, but doesn't taste like a whoopie pie.  It's got a unique texture -- a little crusty on the outside, chewy on the inside.  It was pure heaven.  I took several small bites to make it last.    The next time we went, I skipped the croissant and just went straight for the macarons.  This time, I ordered two -- a raspberry one again and a key lime one.  Again: freaking amazing.  I can't wait to try more and more.  And kudos to this location for being worthy of the original Amelie's name.

8E3ZnSuu0CH_01Iqkv7txg.text: Good selection of pastries and the decor is always worth roaming around to discover a unique piece to snap. However the prices are way too high.

eYz5d2tXfCa3p9KxnX07nA.text: This is my favorite Amelie's location! So easy to park and the decor is great. I love the macarons best of all!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

6ShO8IG5qFBm766SWN4CJg.text: The quality of pastries at Amelie's locations I've visited has been hit and miss and unfortunately the quality of *pastries* at this location, while good when it first opened, has slowly deteriorated to the point where we've stopped going there. In our last visit the puff pastry in a Napoleon wasn't flaky (more soggy than anything else - which in my mind meant it was at least a day old), a pair of different tea cakes were greasy (leaving a lot of buttery residue on the plate) and macaroons we got to go were tasteless and had an incorrect texture (you could feel clumped sugar).  In my opinion, compared to authentic French pastries, Amelie's pastries typically fall well short of the mark.  On the flip side, the coffee is usually very good.

ASariG9BTCqyfI_ZrGZHgQ.text: If you follow my reviews, you might know that I am a fan of the Amelie's concept. I'm not too crazy about the uptown location due to poor service. But it's not so much so that I don't occasionally pop in on break from work. Going into the Park Rd location, I figured I'd have a similar experience at the least: maybe the service would lack but the food and coffee were bound to be good.  Luckily, I was right on the latter and wrong in the former. The ladies working the front line were super friendly and helpful. My friend and I became paralyzed with indecision at all the choices. The girls working there made recommendations, joked with us, and generally made me feel welcome. They even pointed out my friend would get a free eclair for his birthday, something I had no idea Amelie's did.   Sadly, this location is not at all conveniently located to me, especially with the Uptown and NoDa locations. But I occasionally find myself this way and I'm glad to have this as an option for a coffee or afternoon sweet treat.

7MrIOIN42CAZmFj0bddCGw.text: My favorite getaway in Charlotte at all times of the day! It is such a great place to sit back, relax & enjoy scrumptious desserts, teas and coffee! And I am sure I'm not the only one who thinks this especially when you enter at 11 pm and the place is still full of guest enjoying their company. The staff is wonderful! They are willing to help you with your choices so if you can't decide what you want, ask them for help!   My must gets are:  Salted Carmel Brownie: this decadent desert is full of flavor and salt balances out the sweetness so perfectly. The gluten free ones are just as delicious. Yellow and Blue Herbal Tea "The Au Lait" style: this one I will grab when it's late night and I'm going straight to bed after wards. It's a mixture of chamomile, lavender and other ingredients and the milk and honey tops it off so well. (It's a weird combo but I love it!)  Cafe Marcotter: this is Amelie's Signature and the flavors are perfect together!   The dessert case is always full of other desserts that we will pick from so don't forget to check those out as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut Macaroon &amp; Salted Caramel Brownie. Our favorites!
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mint Chocolate Gateau: We love mint but this was a little on the fluoride tasting side for us.

HplZnvQcELvml1F5rBpg9Q.text: Amelies is a cute little restaurant. The decor is fun to look at but as far as French pastries go, Amelies is just  ok. The palmier is good but the chocolate eclair and Napoleon we had did t get finished because they were less than ok. The Napoleon topping and crust were ok but the cream had no flavor. I'm sitting there waiting for the vanilla to kick in but nothing, very flat. The eclair had a good chocolate topping and the filling did have a good vanilla flavor but the crust was bland.  We didn't ha e anything else to go by and we did see quite a few people eating there so maybe we just had a few deserts that weren't as good this time.  The next time I'm in Charlotte I wouldn't mind giving them another try.

Vp9I1bpUZPcdg0iC4FMWAQ.text: Best bakery ever. The macaroons alone are worth it. I had the cotton candy and pistachio, both delicious and very flavorful, perfect amount of crisp and we'll balanced to the filling. My favorite this time around was the new pistachio latte. Little bits of pistachio, salt (I think) and caramel on the top. Sweet and salty beverages are my weakness. I had a breakfast so sandwich on a croissant with guyere cheese and tomato, also very delicious. The cheese was melty and you could tell is was high quality. I can't wait to come back.

mLRiFy_aKkuXJEP9Nf6SBA.text: Amelie's is located in the back of Park Road Shopping Center, where there is plenty of parking.  I have been to a few of the other Amelie locations and they are all fantastic. A staple of this city in fact.  We took my in laws to Amelies this weekend, as it is a place we always take visitors! Fortunately, the Park Road Shopping location is about a mile from our house. I was excited to finally get to check out this location and it did not disappoint. Cute decorations that are consistent with all the other Amelies. French whimsical is what I call it. Lots of seating. We ordered a variety of desserts. I always go for the gluten free salted caramel brownie. (note: I am not actually gluten free but the server asked if she wanted us to change her gloves. We of course said no but if you are actually gluten free and reading this, know they will take care of not contaminating) and my husbands favorite is the chocolate torte. This location also has sandwiches, breakfast options, coffees and wine!! (yay for wine and desserts!). I also love the specialty drinks that they change with the seasons.   Super excited for this new location and I know they will crush it here!

wFaPFKs9isiMY19Rcpn-8w.text: Great outpost of Amelie's on the backside of Park Road Shopping Center.  Of course the sweets are amazing, but don't overlook the savory delights in store here. The spinach, asparagus and leek soup is a brothy, flavorful and reliable menu standard. Grab a ham and cheese on perfectly fresh baked baguette and you'll think you are in Paris. Finish it with a French Macaron and you'll be in Heaven.   They're new in this location and working out a few service and system kinks.  A very welcome addition to the neighborhood.

kNqB1HLVJHHIddf8Tz5s5g.text: The Park Rd. Shopping Center location is as good as all of the other locations. I love Amelie's because of their attention to quality and the fun environment they have. Their coffee is great, and I know if I was more daring, their specialty drinks are even better. I had broccoli cheddar quiche for breakfast, and it was delicious.  A great thing about Amelie's is they are opened for breakfast during the week and it isn't a quick-chain place. I had a friend coming into town, and it was hard to find a breakfast place. All of my usual brunch places weren't open, but alas, Amelie's was! I'll definitely be back.

7tgaaFp_I1RZkAuuqo63WQ.text: I've had multiple bad experiences at this Amelie's location. The service is sub par. Some of the pastries appear burnt, the palmiers specifically are consistently dark brown instead of their usual light golden color. This most recent visit was an order for pick up and when I got home I saw they gave me the wrong salad, even though the right one was listed on the receipt stapled to the bag. Then my sandwich was on a horribly chewy and stale French baguette. I've never had these issues at other locations. Amelie's is one of my favorite places to get lunch but I'm not going to go to this one anymore.

IEegibfitAO_mJcaOPuGow.text: I'm SUPER excited that Amelies has joined the The Back Lot power stores (I just made that up) of Park Road Shopping center.  I've only been to the Uptown location way back when I first moved here a couple of years ago.    Such a great addition to the neighborhood.  Located in the Backlot of Park Road Shopping with lot of parking.  Building is painted a pretty blue on the outside so you can't miss it!   No need to give details about the food.  If you've been, you know it's delicious and if you haven't, GO! Lots of space to sit inside. And a nice big patio for outdoor dining.  I loveeeeeeeeee the decor.  It's like you really stepped into a cafe in France somewhere.  Again, I'm a huge fan.  You can easily come here for breakfast or early lunch and then spend the rest of the day bee-boppin' around to the other great shops!! Welcome to the hood Amelies!!

rFBeVwF8H2BpDse4ZRpokw.text: Bonjour!!  In my book, the ultimate Charlotte weekend would be to take a long walk through the Sugar Creek Greenway, watch a Panthers Home Game, stroll through one of the many art museums, and enjoy a divine snack at Amelie's. Fortunately with the growing number of locations, the latter is becoming more and more convenient!  Most of you will know of the Park Road Shopping Center but may be surprised to find that the backlot behind the main strip is really starting to develop. Right across from Rocksalt is Amelie's newest location. I think the concept I like most about the design for any of their bakeries is that you walk in and their thoughtful decor gives the illusion that they've been there forever. Tables made from reclaimed wood complement the ornate chandeliers throughout. All of the artwork fits the old-world French Bakery theme that really immerses you into a transfixion where time seems to slow down, you can really enjoy whatever you're nibbling on.  So speaking on nibbling, as a near decade-long patron of the 'original' Amelie's in NoDa,  I hadn't ordered the Napoleon until a couple of days ago. It is the ultimate pastry showstopper that they serve in the most traditional fashion of alternating layers of puff pastry and creme, topped with an elegant icing pattern. It's baffling to be such a work of art, yet able to be ordered any time you want. Such an incredibly technical pastry at the drop of a hat is reason enough to stop by. Bravo Amelie's, you've dazzled me dozens of times in the past but this one 'takes the cake!'  If you're looking for more savory refreshments then you're in luck. I think the prominent case of sweets makes the sandwich menu take a bit of a back seat, but you should definitely give it a go. Most of their sandwiches are served on either a croissant or a baguette, but they will gladly swap one out for the other. I'm always debating between the Roast Beef & Manchego  Croissant or the Chicken Salad Croissant. You won't be disappointed by either but don't take my word for it! Be sure to check the menu for seasonal additions and especially the rotating soups that are always just marvelous; perfectly seasoned and wholesome, what more could you ask for?  One day I'm hoping for one of those 'work from home' jobs where I can work on my laptop, sip on Russian Tea, and munch on morsel after morsel at the coffee bar here. Until then, the visits to Amelie's are the feature of my mornings.  Au revoir!

9cJgH67tv1CaaHn3TkTdHA.text: I originally came for the pastries but have found great coffee and have been really impressed with their sandwiches for both breakfast and lunch. Their breakfast sandwiches are big portions and customizable. I don't think I've had the same combo twice. Their Turkey and Brie is delicious and always leaves me wanting a second one because it's so good. One of my favorite sandwiches in the city. I do wish they had some more comfortable sitting locations to be able to sit and read. It seems like their other locations do. A line just for a cup of coffee could move things along on a Saturday morning. But then, how could they entice you with contents they show of fin their case?

AR3Hu5DBPxvj0j-NFshJkg.text: Amazing as always and like the Hwy 51 location the staff is super friendly and the pastry are "Punch a Baby Good . " Now, mind you this is my "After-a- Concert" stop but I just love the atmosphere and decor. Eat, Drink, Tell

pFuVMHtJ6FlfNHNOdWP2CQ.text: Dammit, I love Amelie's lavender lemonade homemade soda. Since I was here for lunch, I ordered one with my sandwich.  I got the chicken salad on a croissant, and while I thought it was a high quality sandwich, I was bummed that the chicken salad contained raw onion. I realize that raw onion is not an unusual ingredient in a chicken salad, but raw onion is kind of a controversial ingredient, right? It should have been listed as an ingredient.  I mean, people who don't like raw onion REALLYYYYY don't like it. I am one of those people. I just don't want to eat anything with raw onion because I don't like the flavor and find it very overpowering.  All of the other chicken salad ingredients were listed on the menu board, but not the onion. Whatever. My husband ate it, lol.  I'll maybe stick with the egg sandwich in the future. Like all of the Amelie's locations, Park Rd is super cute and the staff is very friendly.  There are several tables outdoors, but the layout is a bit awkward, and there's not a lot of shade.  Still a great place to eat/hang out.

pXvNGsF03ockrrJczUKjgw.text: 4 stars for the decor and variety of pastries.   We were the only ones in line and the person at the counter (male, blonde highlights) didn't acknowledge us and wouldn't greet us. He stood there, stared behind us, and was frowning the whole time. 5 minutes later more people come in and he's smiling and showing customer service. I don't know what his problem was but he made the first time experience lame. He was working Friday night around 9:00 pm and I hope you realize it's noticeable when you act different in front of different "types of people" aka ethnicities.

IrgMA1lcN_0YEIPKaRtgVA.text: I became a fan of Amelie's after my friend Charles, from Bordeaux, France introduced me.  I've gotten to know Bill Lamb, one of the owners, and have visited Cafe des Deux Moulin's, where the film Amelie was filmed in Paris.  So, this new place was a little challenging to accept when she first opened.    She reminds of the NoDa original but now she's all grown up.  The Myers Park location is in the Back Lot of Park Road Shopping Center.  Lexus, Mercedes, and Land Rover grace the lot instead of working vans, VW's, and transients.  The place teams with kids and dogs on the weekends.  It is very nice, but somehow not the same.  It was like when I fell in love with this cute girl in high school who would skip school with me, skied with me in Vermont, and wore halter tops and very short cut-offs in the summer.  Now, she returns after graduating from college with her master's degree.  She's the same girl underneath, but no longer a child: refined, elegant, and confident--like a bottle of wine from Bordeaux.  And she's here to stay, serving rich pastries, deep coffee, and flavorful soups and sandwiches--just like NoDa--but with her delicate touch of maturity.    So, why only 4 stars?  I'm still in love with my high school sweetheart--she's a 5 in my book!  Bon appetit, Amelie!

z2nDNauhGx7u4j_MIR-WNA.text: I really enjoy having family and friend time here. The atmosphere is welcoming, with indoor and outdoor seating. I have had lunch here before, and many pastries! At Thanksgiving, I brought a pecan tart from here and was a total hit. Recently when I have been going, the pastries have been lacking flavor. They sound delicious, and have somewhat of a disappointment. I had a pumpkin spice cream puff, which lacked pumpkin flavor. Most recent I had a Neapolitan, which had a great white chocolate flavor on top, but the rest was tasteless. My salted caramel brownie latte was delicious. Two pastries and two drinks were $25.

LqQV0ksg_CfzjQujHZFfxw.text: Doesn't compare to any patisserie in France but it'll do for Charlotte. Funky and cute interior, great for meetups, casual hangouts, and maybe after dinner dessert. I tried one of the smallish chocolate cakes on my bday, and it was very rich. The ganache on top was especially dense. The cake part was a little dry, but the mousse was light and fluffy. I tried the salted caramel brownie as well, which was delicious, but very sweet. The chocolate croissant looked good on the outside but was sadly barely filled with chocolate on the inside. Tragic.

2Nxm1qeSSPjgvvYYMDLlLg.text: Wow!  What a find!  A hidden gem on the back side of a pretty cool strip mall (yes, I DID just use those words in the same sentence).  This place is enormous, and it was packed mid-day mid-week.  There was even a video blogger doing some filming inside while I was there.  The patrons were young and old, including what appeared to be a group of about 12 having a business meeting in one area.  The vibe is cool, chic French, with lots of eclectic seating and decor.  The music is fitting but not obtrusive.  The pastry case is huge, and the simple chocolate croissant and latte I had were perfect.  My only wish is that they had more outdoor seating, and that is was shaded.  On a sunny day, this is the only thing they don't offer much of.  But, the inside...c'est vraiment magnifique!

komByHoSZHpFwrg8vGnJVg.text: I've been to other location but found the new one while staying in nearby SouthPark waiting out Hurricane Irma. And, of course, Amelie's never disappoints!  The location is behind the shopping center (as an FYI) since the GPS kept taking me to the bakery in the front. There's plenty of parking and this location has lots of seating indoors and outdoors.   The decor is just as eclectic as the other location and every little detail makes this a magical experience. There are plenty of sweets to choose from and, honestly, I have yet to try anything that I don't like. Of course, I'm more on the fruitier side but I'm sure the chocolatey delicacies are amazing as well.   Their turkey & brie sandwich is definitely my favorite since it has a homemade seasonal jam. The lemonade is also delicious. I really like that this location has a bar and you can also enjoy drinks there. There's a little bit for everyone to enjoy with family and friends!  I can't wait to visit again!

KnJ3tW_6dXMOONqSepIaaQ.text: Another excellent addition to the Park Road shopping center (I seem to start a lot of my reviews like that lately).    Went to dinner and Burtons and was craving a sweet treat.  Ohhhh the convenience of being able to walk to everything.    Amelie's is located in the back lot of the shopping center - you have to walk behind Michaels past rock salt and it will be on the left.  There is a cute little patio out back and you walk down the stairs from the patio to get to the entrance.  Ordered a small tart, the salted caramel brownie (if you've never been here, please just get this is mine blowing), and a macaroon.  We checked out and then ordered two glasses of wine at the bar and sat on the patio.  This was a nice night cap to my evening!

03waiLimnAhs5ydArQtU7w.text: The Dilworth area is really lacking in places that have good to-go breakfast sandwich options.  Believe me, I've tried a bunch of places and have concluded that Bojangles' is the clear winner.  Sad.  And then Amelie's showed up in the back lot of Park Road Shopping Center.  My first thought was "Ok let's give this place a shot."  I walked in and saw a typical Amelie's decor...mismatched furniture, blue walls comfortable seating.  This location was a bit different, with the wide open space and a nice looking bar next to the coffee machines.  Perfect spot to sit if you're just hanging out by yourself.  The staff is always walking around cleaning and checking in on people, so it's nice to see a place where the employees care.  I saw a breakfast sandwich on the menu...great, we're on the right track!  The menu is simple...start with an egg, pick a bread, choose a protein and select a cheese.  I'm a big ham/egg/cheese sandwich on a croissant sandwich kind of girl, so that's what I got.  Croissant was a little greasy, but the sandwich was great!  Real egg that was freshly cooked with a good portion of warm ham.  YUM!!!  I'm so happy I found my new go-to, to-go breakfast sandwich place.  Not only do I have another great dessert place to pick up some sweets for friends, but I have a place to treat myself on a weekend morning!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast sandwich

4fP6Hm5qow6MY9WS6bC9UA.text: Traveled from out of town.   The fig, bacon, and brie tartine was delicious.  We also had the red pepper one but the combination of fig spread, bacon, and Brie was much better.   The leek soup was flavorful.

2ttF2SPPpdDhn_KdJzkIPw.text: Another popular edition to the growing backlot of Park Road Shopping Center, Amelie's biggest location gets a strong start! We stopped in around 9am on opening Saturday to enjoy some breakfast and experienced a fast-moving line and plenty of smiles.   You know the drill: salted caramel brownies, mouth-watering flaky croissants, and traditional cafe drinks. This visit I enjoyed a raspberry streusel muffin and we got back in line to grab three more croissants to save us a trip for the next morning.   The funky decor permeates throughout three different seating areas, including a large main floor, some elevated seating on the right when you walk in, and a large patio that will certainly get more use once the dog days of summer depart.   I'm glad I tried the lavender + honey soda, as it was a refreshing way to start the day. This Charlotte staple is now more easily accessible for the Myers Park crowd and certainly will stay busy, so I wonder how much the nearby Caribou Coffee will take a hit in business? With Dot Dot Dot speakeasy-style bar and Midwood Smokehouse BBQ, you could spend a whole day eating and drinking around the backlot of Park Road Shopping Center!

kQztu3DG9XTiZ_qdiCJMlQ.text: The yelp mark is in the wrong spot, as it's located in the "backlot" of park road (behind Michaels), but it's easy to find once you're here!   Amelie's, simple, delicious and elegant. I actually don't think there is a bad thing to say about this place. From the mixed up, funky decor to the elegant pastries, it has something for everyone. There's ample room at this location, like all their others, with enough spaces to work where you don't feel like you're taking up too much space. They also brew pure intentions coffee, which is a favorite and added bonus. Come and check it out, you won't be disappointed!

KS1mjuAeQuaxTQq7CLXuww.text: Finally made it to the 3rd location in Charlotte. Are there anymore ? This location is just as quirky, pretty and French as the others . Settled in for my favorite menu items : macaroons and a hot tea. Lots of space and lots of outlets to charge devices. Great for meet-ups, homework, people watching....maybe a little loud for homework on the weekends though. I always try to bring family here when they come to Charlotte, because the food is always good, and the location is always unique. It's French, but not in an intimidating way. There's something for everyone here.

aF8XTLyUO8hWLN_x4cdgoQ.text: It's a very lovely place for meetings and studying. I really adore the rustic mix match of chairs and the decor of this place. Its spacious open late till midnight with free wifi good coffee shop. Coming to the food this definitely overrated not what you expect. I tried the creme brulee and spinach & asiago quiche. Creme brulee had no flavor big no and it had black dots in between I was quite doubtful about it and I asked the staff they said that it was vanilla bean. Nah !!! big no to the creme brulee. Spinach & asiago quiche which was served after 15 minutes I understand that no one can make quiche right then but if they warm up well and serve it would be appreciated. If I take a bite it had too hot warm and cold temperatures at once I really couldn't take this worst thing anymore we just threw it and left that place. I would never suggest this place for their bakery items.

jF42dohIZifY2EfxbtKYlg.text: Great Amelie's location. Since it was on the way back home, we decided to "skip the line" that is always present at the original location in NoDa and head over this way. It's crammed into the back of a shopping center on Park that has just about everything in it you could ever need or want.  But Amelie's is the focus here. They've got almost everything you can get at the main location and they're probably about the same size inside. They get sufficiently packed here too. I joked with my girlfriend that when a new Amelie's opens the local thrift stores must run out of stock - because they furnish the places with only mix-matched furniture and random paintings. They've got the sandwiches menu, the tea and coffee, the cakes, macarons, tarts, salted caramel brownies, petit fours, etc. etc. On this visit I even saw entire macaron cakes.  Lots of seating. It was a rainy day but there's seating outside for when it's not. And the neighborhood is not as sketchy as NoDa - that's certainly a win in my opinion. Closer to home too. The quality isn't even with all Amelie's locations though. Maybe it's a side effect of being so popular that quality is starting to fall. That's the only reason I can't afford them 5 stars because I otherwise love me some Amelie's.

65vjlTF0n04betMfuFZSqA.text: As much as I actually love Amelie's, I must say it almost never fails to disappoint.   Today we got a big bowl of the soup du jour, called chicken pesto.  No chicken was in the bowl, but the nice folks at the counter dished up a fresh one so that fixed it.  Perhaps they should let the rest of their staff know how to stir the soup before serving.   The sandwiches are also disappointing.  The roast beef had two very thin slices of beef and a dab of manchego, the croissant overtoasted but cold.  The lovely turkey and Brie is also tres petit.  I don't expect American-sized portions but if they downsize their portions they should downsize their prices accordingly.   My side salad had challengingly large chunks of unpeeled regular cucumber.  Even the rural French would scoff at this overly clumsy attempt at country cuisine.    We did not get any cake this time but I have to say I no longer get any cake at Amelie's.  There is little cake in their cake; it is mostly unappetizingly stiff, mostly flavorless butter cream.  The cake that is there must be made from unpleasantly flavorless foam, not a proper sponge.  Today's peche tatin had better delicate flavor, but the bottom of the short crust was too hard to cut with a fork without leaving red marks on my hand.   The cafe glace was a bit too bitter.  They should choose a different brewing method for their iced coffee.   Perhaps the management would do well to have their bakers and chefs taste and critique their work thoroughly every day before serving it to the public.  And ship in some real French pastries, at least the ones that the local staff haven't yet mastered, for them to taste.  I hope Amelie's won't rest on their laurels and will work to improve their offerings.

mMtqPVF3BYdc_PoaMSTVXA.text: This was the first breakfast place I visited when I came to visit my folks in Charlotte for the first time. My mom had seen them in a Charlotte magazine and suggested we all check it out because they made French macaron.   The location was very quiet when I came in - I had come off a red eye flight from LAX and we went around the time it opened, which is why there weren't many people there. The gals behind the counter were friendly and prompt with taking the orders for the breakfast sandwiches (the first time I ordered one, the gal offered to have double bacon put on mine because I didn't want to add any greens to the sandwich).   Food came out pretty quickly - I'd say it took 7 minutes tops the first time I came. (They've tried to ensure that food comes out in a timely manner whenever I've gone.) I like how crisp their bread is for their sandwiches and the eggs are never brown or rubbery. (I've had that struggle with places where egg sandwiches usually come with slightly browned eggs or eggs that have a rubbery texture to them.)  The pastries behind the displays are beautiful and their macarons are great.   The atmosphere is pleasant and a bit quirky - you can easily sit and enjoy your food and a cup of something hot to drink while soaking up the decor. You get French cafe vibes with some punny humor like the Bach joke by the door, the height ruler showing the heights of famous people, etc.   Prices are fair on the items and I always enjoy coming back here for breakfast and some macaron to go.

YY2juRr02bHoBSCEMF-x0Q.text: I wish that Amelie's had more options for thills that they use. I don't do dairy so I find choosing a beverage difficult. The bathrooms at the park road location when I visited were horrible. Not sure how often they check them but they should check them More often.

Fq1uKikI3pgSN8YE5SqGxg.text: Going to Amelie's is always a treat. The Park Rd location sits behind the shopping center. There's plenty of parking and outdoor seating.  Of course, the French-inspired grubs are yummy! Amelies also offers wine! Yes, please! Naturally, Amelies is a Great place to unwind, work, or meet with friends. The atmosphere is great, and the staff is friendly. I always appreciate their recommendations. Overall this cafe is clean and tidy.   There's a lot to choose from if you're interested in pastry and desserts, soups, salads and more. I'm truly obsessed with the macarons, the flavors change each season. I had the pleasure of trying the NEW Lavender Lemon Macaron Ice Cream Sandwich! The Lemon sorbet was zesty and refreshing. I would recommend sharing this dessert with a friend(it's huge). Naturally, I couldn't leave without purchasing a few other Macarons, I tried three new flavors (Passionfruit, Key lime, and blackberry basil). FYI the blackberry basil is DELISH!

41R399DmQoRksFcLbTAbCw.text: I always get the same thing... Salted Caramel Brownie and Chai tea. Well that is if I'm not eating a meal there. I just can't move away from that brownie. My husband will try other deserts and has always enjoyed every item he has picked. This is our go to place for a relaxing cup of coffee and a chat. We bring friends here from out of town, and they always enjoy it.

4GUsDRghJwGdcNnOHDDoeA.text: It's Amelie's. Really, what's not to like? I've had good experiences at two others three times and so it goes. After securing a macaron sampler to share soon-ish (cotton candy, raspberry, and lemon) I needed a wee box of treats that would not succumb to the evening's warmth while dining out and was set up with seasonal tea cakes, passion fruit muffins, and upscale mini elephant ears which performed as advertised and were consumed later with much joy and gusto. Basking in the glow of MLB's smile I missed another photo op... Really like the "Provence Trailer Park" decorating scheme: furniture collage, odd accents, bright lighting, and some of the finest bad art pieces I've seen this side of Arkansas. Someone went to a great deal of trouble to get it set up like this so spend a few minutes to soak in it and get over yourself. Short on time? grab some bench and have a napoleon, there's always time for napoleon.

ePSrmCN3AkimUgqqeSy2mQ.text: Amelie's is an amazing spot for coffee, pastries and a quick bite. Like the other locations, this newest location has a unique decor with tables, booths and couches to allow customers to feel comfortable during their visit.  I recently tried a lunch sandwich, the Turkey and Bacon. OMG, so good. It is served on a buttery croissant with herbs de Provence mayonnaise and cheese. It sure hit the spot.  With that said, the real highlight to my recent visit was the salted caramel bar, heaven. I don't think I have ever gone to Amelie's without getting one.  Another great addition to the Park Road Shopping Center!

8Zt4FfnAmjPfbmcp5dfVQw.text: The service was great, the place looked and smelled like fresh baked food. It was full of people, reading, emailing, chatting and eating. As far as the baked goods, they were okay. I'm not French, so I may be completely wrong

F6IpjGt5ABBUHPK76XCtNA.text: I popped in with my parents for a sweet treat.  It's nestled behind Park Road shopping center.  I'm excited to report that there's an alternate entrance with a ramp if the steps at the main entrance are an issue (just follow the sign).  Great location, friendly staff and lots of great choices!  Plenty of parking. Eclectic but tastefully decorated.  We visited on Friday mid-afternoon.  They were busy but seating was not an issue.  Customers of all ages were there.  Some catching up with old friends, others working on their computers.   We were promptly assisted at the counter by the kind young lady.  She answered our questions on the pastry options and flavors.  Plenty of staff on duty to ensure a speedy checkout.  Everyone in our group was super satisfied with our selections.  We had the chocolate eclair, a cupcake, fruit danish (fresh strawberry and kiwi).  Very good and delicate pastries.  Happy to report that they were not overly sweet.    We'll definitely be back soon to try more pastry options.

iCXTXXrNArjEXFtD4Ap37A.text: I'm glad that I have another convenient location to visit for Amelie's!   As always the decor is fresh, French and fabulous.  Big enough that you don't feel crowded and plenty of space to spread out.  As always, seats and plug spaces are at a premium for people who like to work in coffee shops!  I tried the Cafe marcotte?  I'm not sure if that's the exact spelling, but the punch of espresso mellowed with the caramel and sea salt was delicious.    Can wait to go again soon!

ACGodHc8o1169uWimKsM6g.text: Amelie's was one of the highlights of our trip to Charlotte! Not only is the atmosphere eclectic and charming, it's what I'd imagine any great bakery in France would be.   All of their desserts are made there and believe it or not, this was my first time ever having a macaroon! But I have to say, I'm happy Amelie's was where it first happened.   My husband and I not only shared three of their dozens of different types of pastries but we also shared a French press. I loved it! They served it to us on a silver plater with all the accomplishments we needed. Such a great deal as well, we both we were able to have two cups and still have coffee left.   Amelie's came highly recommended to us before leaving Charlotte and I'm happy we did. It's truly a Charlotte gem.

GQ4jpIhnIQAjBMIoLPJMXQ.text: When I just can't even any more I like to go to Amelie's. This is the perfect place to wrap yourself in your infinity scarf, read a good book and sip on your coffee while using their free wifi. The atmosphere is quaint. Almost TOO quaint. Like "Am I supposed to live here now? It's so cozy."  This is a great place to bring your headphones and an electronic device of your choice with you. Surrounded by fellow patrons in yoga pants and Uggs you will feel right at home. The cashier recognized my Rick and Morty t-shirt and we had a hilarious conversation about how much her son loves the show. You had to be there.  They are hidden away in the back of the Park Road Shopping Center so if your map app doesn't get you there don't give up. You are so close. I've only ordered coffee and breakfast sandwiches from here so far but I hear they have great pastries. Perhaps next visit. Oh, there will be a next visit.  Sidenote: Sean King I know you're reading this. Unblock me on Twitter. Not cool bro.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

7im1UNA7pmkEvbQjRk_NSA.text: I am not usually a dessert person myself but after hearing about the Bakery, as well as amazing drinks they had we decided to check it out. Starting off the decor and way the place is designed is beyond interesting and beautiful. It is also way larger than one would expect for a bakery/cafe combo, it may be one of the largest I've ever been in.   The menu was very easy to read and almost everything sounded great. I will admit that most of my time was spent drooling while looking through the display for desserts and macaroons. I ended up going with a Strawberry Lemonade Macaroon and then one of their strawberry and lemon based drinks (are you starting to see a theme here, it's literally my favorite flavor of most things). Let me tell you...Amelie's did not disappoint, oh my goodness I am now in a bad mood because I don't have one of these in my hometown.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

pHBOYTC2n7_hn5LSyzxnig.text: Four stars for service...2-3 for food.  Let me tell you why! This is our 5th visit to this Amelie's location. Each visit is good to meh...its ok. The pastries are dry and overly sweet, specifically the Carmel brownie. The quality of the macaroons reflect grocery store mass produced, and sadly, they are not melt in your mouth delectable. Why come so many times? It's closer than the downtown store and we keep thinking the quality will be that of the flagship store.   It's ok here..the baguettes are good, the coffee is good quality and we like a few other things. But it's just three star tasty

He_4M9yh5u4PEZKvi7N46w.text: After all the hype, all the reviews, we were so excited to give this place a try. The atmosphere the customer service is excellent! Unfortunately that's where it ended. The Neapolitan desert icing on top had the consistency of a piece of rubber and The pastry was raw and was un edible. The chocolate cake was very dry. It appears the desserts had been frozen for a couple of days and then thawed out.   Maybe I'll try them again at another location

UKsxI-eqmZ-mnIrg1RlR8w.text: We had heard positive things about Amelie's from local friends, but aside from the positive experience of dealing with incredibly friendly staff, the atmosphere was too crazy, and the tarts that we had were simply "okay."   The space is massive inside, ornately-decorated to a fault. I'm sure it's meant to be part of their gimmick, but it just added to the perceived chaos of the place. We were there at a lull, so without others sort of leading the way, I wasn't 100% sure of the ordering location or process. It was also pretty loud, despite it not being too full. Regardless, the staff were very friendly, answering any questions that I had, and the checkout process was pretty smooth. Since we had two ready-made items, I didn't have to wait, which was nice! There's a sizable outdoor patio, as well, which is where we went because we had our pup with us.  Sure, the atmosphere wasn't my style, but the main reason that I can only give 3 stars is simply the tarts being pretty average. They're not the worst tarts I've had, but lacked the richness in their crust that I'm used to at some of the other French bakeries that we frequent. The texture wasn't there, either. The crust was very soft and bland, and their filling was essentially the same. Perhaps they had been sitting for too long, but even if the texture was there, there just wasn't enough flavor.  Overall, I'll admit that this is purely a subjective rating. We had higher expectations, otherwise, I'd have graded on a friendly curve. Would I return and try some of their sandwiches or baked goods? Sure, but if I'm craving pastries, Amelie's isn't going to be the first spot that comes to mind, unfortunately.

KTjrcnqerOoPY_z_Pl5KcQ.text: My wife and I would come here a lot, but I think that is going to change. The last three visits have not been up the par. Our orders have never come out right at this location. I passed it off because a few times have been during peek hours, but this is not always the case. Today, after waiting at the counter to order a beverage I was turned away and told to get back in line. I was next in line to order and you tell me otherwise? If you want me to return have your management fix the inconsistency with the service.

COqXi8BaYp4cvWrY9oIjlQ.text: Ce cafe est tres mignon!  I'm so happy I had the chance to check out Amelie's while in Charlotte last week. My two colleague pals and I stopped in for an afternoon pick-me-up. I had a cafe au lait and two mini mousse cups which were delicious. They were rich enough to satisfy my sweet tooth without making me feel too guilty for indulging. My friend had a salted caramel brownie which looked incredible!   I loved the outdoor seating though the inside was very cute and probably a great option for working.

KlRVpdD4Ega6W8-0Q4yHxA.text: I recently visited Amelie's while in town on business. It is a very interesting place with a wide selection of gourmet coffee beverages and sweets. The interior is very cool and the staff was very friendly. It is a great place to meet a friend to talk or relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

L69qQSpbeRpIoOl4iPhITg.text: So I've been meaning to check out this new location for a while now, but I usually end up going to either Uptown or the original NoDa location whenever I think of going to Amelies.  I'm glad I finally got around to checking out this location, it's just as unique when you put them all side-by-side.  Located behind Park Rd Shopping center, I always knew this "back alley" had so much potential and a bit of "hidden mystery" so adding an Amelies here makes so much sense.  The space is almost sunken into the basement of whatever resides on top of the structure in the front (bikesource maybe?)  You walk through the outdoor patio, which will be nice when the weather warms up, and descend down some stairs to the entrance.  You get immediately hit by all things Amelie between the signature blue stripped wall covering and all the chandeliers.  Make your way to the Pastry Case and the lovely staff will help make your selections and either box the up or present them on a plate for you to enjoy there.  If you want something more savory, order at the counter and you are given a number while your food is prepared.  The bar is located in the back left and your coffees and drinks are prepared there.  I noticed a ton of tables and two different levels- one loft-ish level and then a large open space in the middle.  Given that the space is in "the basement" it is very cozy... I'm not that y'all, but there are a lot of ducts and vents to avoid, but the space is wonderfully done.    Sad there isn't a window to watch bakers make treats like Uptown, but it captures the original NoDa  location fairly well.   The back of PRSC is full especially with the opening of Midwood's other location, but there is plenty of parking which makes this Amelies a great/convenient place to meet up.  On my first visit there was a large group of 20 ladies and their grandkids meeting up- they took up a lot of the front of the store, but there were plenty of other tables to accommodate everyone.

icaSJVRFe7Yj7nQ7VoxXKg.text: After two visits to Charlotte and Amelie, I figure its time to craft a review! This most recent visit, we counted on Amelie to kick our butts into gear with some caffeine and quiche before a long day of traveling on the road. Note to self: Charlotte has few options open on Sunday mornings. We opted for a breve latte, a seasonal chai/cranberry espresso drink and two slices of the quiche. The seasonal cranberry chai espresso drink was a little sweet for my taste but I enjoyed the chicken lorraine quiche.   The space is very Alice in Wonderland meets French tea party with whimsical lighting, wall decorations and charming mismatching tables and chairs. If you're looking to meet up with a large group, this spot is for you. It's fairly large on the coffee shop/bakery scale. Parking is very easy and I appreciated that they also had bike parking and ADA accessible entrance clearly marked. The staff was very friendly during our recent visit. My only hesitation in the fifth star is that we were the only ones there and it took a solid 15-20 minutes for our grab and go quiche to be heated up before hitting the road which seemed slow given that it was just us.

3lxPSX_uUw7JzeTVPEg7Gw.text: Don't get this rating wrong. The pastries and coffee here are 4 star. The deductions are for the atmosphere. If you want to chill and relax, this is NOT the place to be. The shop is below grade and has a lot of hard surfaces. It's quite noisy, I cannot understand how people use this place for studying. If you sit across someone you have to almost yell. I typically get my order to go, because it is so damn good.   I recommend: - Napoleon - Twice baked croissant - any tart (the minis are my fave) - Croque Monsieur - Almond croissant  anything is good....those were just my go-tos.  The location is at the back of the Park Rd shopping mall. So you won't actually see it from the main parking lot.

jZ6jhHsfhWS-nrji-4Armg.text: Some hits, some misses. We ordered 2 cinnamon chocolate macaroons, 1 eclair, 1 salted caramel brownie, 1 chocolate and 1 Strawberry vanilla Petit gateau. Total came to about $24. Cinnamon chocolate macaroons had good texture, nice chew, but tasted like what I imagine eating potpourri would be like.. the cinnamon was so powerful it caused a mild burning sensation in my mouth, also the pairing with the chocolate is an off combo, I'd advise not choosing that flavor. Wife loved the eclair, said the salted caramel brownie was strange yet ate the whole thing... The chocolate.petit.gateau.i..... air-y, chocolate-y, moist, rich-but-not-too-rich little cake. Easily the star of the visit. Unfortunately it's brother from another mother, the vanilla strawberry, was kinda meh.. icing had a flat taste. Best described as tasting like butter with a pinch of sugar and vanilla hiding somewhere inside it. The cake was about an hour away from being extremely dried out and while the strawberry icing inside was good, it couldn't save the cakes shortcomings. Would I make a second visit? I would be hesitant to return for anything except that chocolate Petit gateau.

Vk2AdDSSk309gHKod2e2VA.text: In the course of meeting a friend for coffee, I had the opportunity to visit Amelie's not once, but twice within a week.  Being a caffeine addict, I was totally down for both experiences!  Finding Amelie's can be a bit of a challenge because the cafe is located BEHIND the Park Road Shopping Center.  So let me just take a moment here to caution you not to follow the signs pointing to the front.  I'm not sure why those signs exist but I will tell you that they are confusing and unhelpful to the caffeine-deprived.  So ignore them, drive to the back and you can't miss the place.  I was blown away when I walked in!  This place is huge with so many seating options:  tons small cafe tables with intentionally mismatched chairs, cushioned booths, and even longer tables for groups.  You will find an appealing place to sit, I promise!  There is even outdoor seating if that's the sort of environment you prefer, but it's July here so indoor seating was the better option for me.  The decor here is on pointe for a French bakery.  The beverage menu is extensive:  lots of hot and cold coffees and teas, Italian sodas, and Mimosas -- YES!  So many kinds of Mimosas.  I could come here just to day-drink and munch on French pastries, but for these two visits, I stuck to coffee and iced tea.  The coffee was rich with undertones of cherry.  The iced tea beverage I tried was a green tea/blueberry concoction that was absolutely perfect for a hot July day.   I also tried a couple of coconut macaroons which were fabulous.  I will definitely be going back to try out other pastries... and day-drink because 1) I'm up for the challenge and 2) Mimosas!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amélie&#39;s Park Road

Q51ACbLlXRqmiemPzh7FsQ.text: Who doesn't love Amelie's? It's a Charlotte staple. I've been to the NoDa and Uptown locations but this was my first time at the Park Road location. We had dinner at the backlot so we decided to walk over for some dessert.   It's a pretty nice space. It's pretty big and very open. There's a patio outside, but there's no food or drink allowed out there which is interesting.   We got a few macarons (birthday cake, caramel apple, and smores), a pumpkin macaron ice cream sandwich, and a spiced pumpkin and cream cheese entrement. Everything was delicious, but the ice cream sandwich was my favorite!  If you've never been to Amelie's before, it's definitely a must try!

CKjFkug4JxPMJ6NKYHleGg.text: Too overrated, nothing special. Lots of artificial coloring being used in this bakery, so unnatural. You could smell those fake dyes in the air too, scary. No thanks, definitely a place to skip without a second thought.

NFDy3WdiwA2PtNg9xz94dg.text: Perhaps it was because my expectations were far too high for a dessert at 10 pm. But wow. I am very disappointed. First off creme brulee is my favorite dessert of all time so I was shocked to realize they would do Togo. They asked if I'd like it brulee'd which made me laugh because what do you call un brulee'd,  creme brulee?! lol. Anyway then they had a variety of macaroons. Instead of having the counter guy name them all, I felt bad, I said "what are your most unique"?! I'm also a fan of odd flavors. He named like 6 which I'm forgetting of now(that's how boring the flavors were) before he mentioned rose water/flower? Idk but I was intrigued. I was so excited To get these home. How cool that a dessert shop was open so late!!! Well I'm so let down. My brulee was burnt and too bitter to eat, and my beautifully flavored macaroon was stale and not at all crunchy. I tried to eat around the burnt sugar and just eat the custard... just as disappointing. No flavor and all gelatin. Worst "creme brulee" I've ever had. Crushed with disappointment, I think I'll stick with a McFlurry next time.

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stale rose water/petal macaroon

Wtkug8ncAuNNi7g2150rGQ.text: What's not to like??! It's another Amelie's. This one is pretty large and serves mimosas too! Amelie's is consistently awesome and always indulges my cravings.   Park behind Park Road Shopping Center and the hop on the Greenway to walk off your salted Carmel brownie(s).

aFkii-Q5XAg27fB2Ig4OHg.text: I have eaten at this lovely bakery countless times, and each time, it never disappoints. The eclectic decor and ambiance match the delicious food. I usually come for the amazing desserts, but the regular food is really yummy too. My favorite pastry is the chocolate and raspberry tart. I always get a couple macaroons, too. I quite like them, but they may be a little too sweet for some people. Today, I tried the banana split layered torte for the first time, which I found very yummy. The bakery case boasts a huge variety of treats, so there is something at Amelie's for everyone. I highly recommend checking out the regular menu, too. The restaurant is always clean with a friendly staff. Be ready to take some pictures with the quirky and cool decorations. Amelie's is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana split layered torte, key lime macaron, and raspberry macaron.

gvC_Zm0Fiwy7kz6PdlRsHw.text: I love this location of Amelie's. The only downfall is it's hard to find the first time. On GPS, you will look like you keep passing it in Park Rd Shopping Center. It's actually immediately BEHIND the main section of the shopping center. It's behind the Caribou Coffee/bagel place. There's a small road behind the shopping center and you get to it from there. This location has a lot of room, yet is made so quaint and comfy. There are many sections with couches, small and a couple bigger tables, a fireplace. The pastry selection is wonderful and SO yummy. And the coffee and bar area is top notch. Much larger than other locations. There is a large patio to sit and it's very comfortable.

iaUVSCpveD5Nk0lzvbe3KQ.text: Insanely cute and homey spot to spend an afternoon or evening. And if they don't offer the dessert of your dreams I'd be amazed. The macaroons alone would keep your sweet tooth satisfied for a long long time. Yum.

fBgniZgHl5akgo_EiQkdcA.text: Becoming... NO, is a charlotte staple. I have frequent the original local on many occasions. I have seen bible study, women meeting, and girls hanging out, People with dyed hair, no hair, and wings, pre-med Student studying and groups catching up. This is an inclusive space and more importantly a safe one. I am actually a fan of their pastries although my friends would beg to differ. They love the savory soups and sandwiches. I started my Amelie affection based on the tart (hazelnut was my fav) but have shifted to their palmers, macrons and recently sticky buns. They have an eclectic variety of options made fresh daily and with that being said it can be hit or miss on the available options. Be open-minded while going as the prices are not for the faint of heart. The decor is cute and Parisian inspired which is a cute homage. Now that they have branched out I have found that there are more locations in and around charlotte and can always sneak in for a quite bite, download, coffee or chat with friends. I highly suggest you give it a try. Don't be surprised if you being to plan your next vacay to Paris. Bonjour!

gzjrQVvj6egSsoE4P8s-uQ.text: Disappointed! I Usually go to the NoDa location (which I love) but decided to try this one since it's closer to where I live. The Desserts are not the same level of quality at this location. The macaron has a thick jelly in the middle instead of a "filling". It's so thick u can see it hanging out from the side of it. It totally over powers the taste of the entire macaron. Taste more like jelly filled cookies or a jelly roll than a macaron. The iced sticky bun was disappointing as well as it was burnt around the edges. As of matter of fact, All of them in the display were burnt. I still decided to try it tearing off the burnt edges of the bun. They definitely shouldn't have served them. The bun taste ok but drier than what I'm used to having at NoDa's location. The salted caramel brownie was good & same taste/quality as the other location. Overall, It's worth the drive to NoDa instead of this location next time...
